table_metadata.description: This dataset delineates parcels with “Taxable Commercial Space” - meaning parcels where one or more property owner(s) and/or commercial tenant(s) are required to file or pay the Commercial Vacancy Tax. Information about each filing received for the parcel is included, such as Filer Type (Owner / Tenant), Filer Name, and Situs Address from Filing, whether the filer reported a vacancy, and if so, the tax rate applied. column_metadata.description: The date of the purchase order
Completed payments to vendors.
Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco. Examples include Recreation and Parks, Public Works, and the Police Department.
A program identifies the services a department provides.
In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies are recorded as different Characters.
In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, within the Salaries Character, Objects differentiate between Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.

In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level of detail. For instance, within the Overtime Object, Sub-object segregates overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters (known as uniformed staff).

whom_it_may_interest: This data may interest economists, city planners, independent auditors, and anyone else interested in how much San Francisco spends and on what. It contains detailed financial data that could potentially uncover interesting trends.
